body.p: To His Excellency Tho E Bramlette Govr Ky
your petitioner Jeremiah Cash would state that on the 13th of July 1859 he was fined sixty Dollars by the Hardin Circuit Court for keeping a Tipling House

your petitioner states that he was nearly blind & unable to do any thing to support his family & his neighbors advised him to set up a little grocery & that as he was too poor to pay for a license and blind that he would be in ^no^ danger. your petitioner was not well posted in law & driven to necessity did sell some whiskey & when Indicted for it came to court made no defenses acknowledged the act & asked for mercy, but the Jury had to find against him

Petitioner states that he is yet nearly blind & poor & a family of six children to support, that since he was indicted he quit selling and asks your excellency as an act of mercy to remit the fine
Nov. 23d 1863
We the undersigned are acquainted with the petitioner and believe he has told the truth about the matter named therein & hope the fine will be remitted Nov 23d 1863

Hardin Cir Ct
vs
J. Cash
$60 --
Tipling
7th Dec/ 63

Remit all except fees & costs
T E Bramlette
